definition[0]: to connect someone to someone else on the telephone
example[0]: Could you put me through to Eddie?
definition[1]: to pay for someone to study at school, college etc
example[1]: She worked as a waitress and put herself through school.
definition[2]: to make someone do or experience something difficult or unpleasant
example[2]: The soldiers were put through eight weeks of basic training.
example[3]: They really put me through it at the interview.
definition[3]: to do what is necessary in order to get a plan or suggestion accepted or approved
example[4]: Production will start up again when these changes have been put through.
